channel.title: Tech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Tech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Americans Are Increasingly Convinced That Aliens Have Visited Earth
item.description: Polling shows that nearly half of Americans now believe aliens have visited this planet—and that the number who aren't sure has dropped by two-thirds....

item.title: The Avatar Game Is So Good, They Don’t Need to Make the Movies Anymore
item.description: See the new movie Avatar: Fire and Ash if you’d like. But if you really want to experience the big blue world of Pandora, the video game is where it’s...

item.title: TikTok agrees to deal to cede control of US business to American investor group
item.description: The deal closes a long-running drama in which U.S. authorities have sought to compel ByteDance to divest.

item.title: Krafton hikes India bet with new $670M fund
item.description: Called the Unicorn Growth Fund, the investment vehicle is a collaboration between Krafton and South Korean internet conglomerate Naver, and investor M...

item.title: Ring Promo Codes and Discounts: Up to 50% Off
item.description: Discover how to save on Ring cameras, doorbells, outdoor cameras, and more.

item.title: This Chrome Extension Turns LinkedIn Posts About AI Into Facts About Allen Iverson
item.description: The developers of a browser tool that changes AI-centric LinkedIn posts to Allen Iverson facts want to help “take back control of your experience of t...

item.title: From Queer-Baiting to Neurodivergence: ‘Heated Rivalry’s Author Tackles Fan Theories and Controversy
item.description: “I didn't expect this book to be analyzed like The Great Gatsby,” hockey smut author Rachel Reid tells WIRED.

item.title: OpenAI is reportedly trying to raise $100B at an $830B valuation
item.description: The ChatGPT maker is aiming to raise the funding by the end of the first quarter in 2026, and the company may ask sovereign wealth funds to invest in ...

item.title: Hacks, thefts and disruption: The worst data breaches of 2025
item.description: TechCrunch looks back at the biggest data breaches, disruptive cyberattacks, and damaging hacks of 2025, from the raiding of U.S. government databases...

item.title: Apple becomes a debt collector with its new developer agreement
item.description: Apple says it can now collect any money a developer owes the tech giant at any time.
